title: A Story of Consistency: Bridging the Gap between Bentham and Rawls Foundations. (arXiv:2303.07488v1 [econ.TH])
abstract: The axiomatic foundations of Bentham and Rawls solutions are discussed within the broader domain of cardinal preferences. It is unveiled that both solution concepts share all four of the following axioms: Nonemptiness, Anonymity, Unanimity, and Continuity. In order to fully characterize the Bentham and Rawls solutions, three variations of a consistency criterion are introduced and their compatibility with the other axioms is assessed. Each expression of consistency can be interpreted as a property of decision-making in uncertain environments.

translated_title: 一篇关于一致性的故事：弥合本丹姆和罗尔斯基础之间的差距
translated_abstract: 在基数偏好的更广领域内讨论了本丹姆和罗尔斯解的公理基础。揭示了这两种解决方案概念都共享以下四个公理：非空性，匿名性，一致性和连续性。为了充分表征本丹姆和罗尔斯解决方案，引入了三种一致性标准的变体，并评估它们与其他公理的兼容性。每个一致性表达式可以被解释为在不确定环境下进行决策的特性。
tldr: 研究了基数偏好中的本丹姆和罗尔斯解的公理基础，得出两种解决方案共享四个公理：非空性，匿名性，一致性和连续性。引入了三种一致性标准的变体，以充分表征两种解，这些标准可以解释为在不确定环境下进行决策的特性。
en_tdlr: This paper studies the axiomatic foundations of Bentham and Rawls solutions in cardinal preferences and discovers that both solutions share four axioms: Nonemptiness, Anonymity, Unanimity, and Continuity. Three variations of a consistency criterion are introduced to fully characterize the solutions and can be interpreted as decision-making properties in uncertain environments.
